masters.title: Master's Degree Courses
masters.subtitle: University of Brescia • 2024-2026 • Current Weighted Average: 27.71/30 (72 CFU)

courses.name: Neural Network Architectures
courses.description: Advanced neural architectures for representation learning and generative modeling. Covers Transformer-based models for NLP (BERT, GPT, Large Language Models), autoencoders and variational autoencoders, GANs and diffusion models for image generation, and Graph Neural Networks with message-passing.

courses.name: Deep Learning
courses.description: Course focused on deep neural network models and training techniques. Covers gradient-based learning and backpropagation, regularization and optimization strategies, convolutional and recurrent neural networks with attention mechanisms. Includes practical implementation for computer vision and NLP.

courses.name: Advanced Information Systems and Big Data
courses.description: Modern data architectures and enterprise information systems. Covers design methodologies for data architectures, MES, CPPS for Industry 4.0, Digital Thread and Internet of Production. Big Data technologies include distributed processing with Hadoop, MapReduce, Spark, and many NoSQL databases.

courses.name: Artificial Intelligence
courses.description: Technical AI course focused on state-space search algorithms (BFS, DFS, A*, IDA*, local search), heuristic design, propositional and FOL with resolution and unification, CSP (backtracking, arc-consistency), automated planning using STRIPS/ADL/PDDL and Graphplan and probabilistic reasoning with Bayesian Networks.

courses.name: Network Security
courses.description: Advanced cryptography and network defense course covering symmetric encryption (AES, ChaCha20, 3DES), asymmetric systems (RSA, Diffie-Hellman), hash functions (SHA, HMAC), and digital signatures. Deep dive into IPSec/VPN architectures, SSL/TLS protocols, PKI infrastructure, and wireless security, including mobile network authentication.

courses.name: Algebra for Codes
courses.description: Mathematical foundations for error-correcting codes and cryptographic systems. Studied algebraic structures (groups, rings, fields), finite field arithmetic (GF), linear codes, and coding theory applications. Explored Reed-Solomon codes, BCH codes, and their role in modern communication systems and data integrity verification.

courses.name: Business Strategy
courses.description: Strategic management course covering competitive analysis frameworks (Porter's Five Forces, SWOT, PESTEL), corporate and business-level strategy formulation, market positioning, and value chain analysis. Studied case studies in strategic decision-making, M&A strategies, and sustainable competitive advantage development.

courses.name: Information Systems
courses.description: Enterprise information systems architecture covering operational systems (OLTP, ERP, CRM) and decision support systems (OLAP, Business Intelligence). Analyzed KPI definition, Critical Success Factors identification, data warehouse design, and digital transformation strategies for modern organizations.

courses.name: Web Agile Programming
courses.description: Full-stack web development using modern frameworks and Agile methodologies. Mastered client-side technologies (HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, jQuery, AJAX), server-side development with PHP/Laravel and Eloquent ORM, RESTful API design, and SOA principles. Hands-on experience with MVC architecture, database integration, and responsive design.

courses.name: Systems Administration
courses.description: Cross-platform systems administration covering Windows Server (Active Directory, Group Policy, Kerberos), Linux (BIND, Apache, Sendmail), and macOS environments. Explored virtualization technologies, cloud computing architectures, high-availability clustering, backup strategies, and enterprise infrastructure management best practices.

courses.name: Machine Learning & Data Mining
courses.description: Comprehensive machine learning course covering supervised learning (decision trees, SVM, neural networks, ensemble methods), unsupervised learning (K-means, DBSCAN, hierarchical clustering), and NLP fundamentals. Hands-on Python implementation with scikit-learn, feature engineering, model evaluation, and real-world data mining applications.

courses.name: Modeling and Simulation
courses.description: System dynamics and control engineering course covering linearization techniques, system identification, and model validation. Developed expertise in MATLAB/Simulink for simulating grey-box, black-box, and ARX models. Applied feedback linearization and state-space representations to real-world control system problems.

courses.name: Scientific Computing
courses.description: Numerical methods for scientific computing including iterative solvers for linear/nonlinear systems, polynomial interpolation, numerical quadrature, finite differences, and ODE solvers (Euler, Runge-Kutta). MATLAB implementation of algorithms with focus on numerical stability, convergence analysis, and computational efficiency.

courses.name: Algorithms & Data Structures
courses.description: Advanced algorithms course covering complexity analysis (Big-O, recurrence relations), sorting algorithms, graph algorithms (BFS, DFS, Dijkstra, Bellman-Ford), dynamic programming, and computational complexity theory. Studied P vs NP, NP-completeness, Turing machines, and reduction techniques for algorithmic problem solving.

courses.name: Algebra and Geometry
courses.description: Linear algebra fundamentals including vector spaces, linear transformations, matrix operations, eigenvalue decomposition, and quadratic forms. Applied concepts to solve systems of linear equations, geometric transformations, and optimization problems in engineering contexts.

courses.name: General Electronics
courses.description: Semiconductor device physics and analog circuit design covering diodes, BJT and MOSFET transistors, operational amplifiers, comparators, and switching circuits. Analyzed bipolar and CMOS logic families with focus on digital IC design principles and signal conditioning.

courses.name: Digital Electronics Systems
courses.description: Digital system design covering combinational and sequential logic, finite state machines, programmable logic devices (FPGA, CPLD), and embedded systems development. Hands-on VHDL programming, timing analysis, and Arduino-based prototyping for real-time applications.

courses.name: Operating Systems
courses.description: Operating system internals covering process management, thread synchronization, CPU scheduling algorithms, memory management (paging, segmentation), file systems, and I/O subsystems. Practical Linux shell programming and system call implementation for resource management.

courses.name: Computer Systems
courses.description: Advanced computer architecture covering multiprocessor systems (UMA/NUMA/COMA), client-server architectures, middleware platforms, clustering technologies, and storage systems. Analyzed performance metrics, backup strategies, and enterprise computing infrastructure design.

courses.name: Telecommunications
courses.description: Signal processing and communication systems fundamentals including Fourier analysis, modulation techniques (AM, FM, QAM), channel coding, and network protocols. Studied Shannon's theorem, bandwidth optimization, and modern telecommunication system architectures.

courses.name: Physics II
courses.description: Electromagnetism course covering electrostatics, magnetostatics, Maxwell's equations, electromagnetic wave propagation, and optics. Applied theoretical concepts to engineering problems in antenna design, electromagnetic compatibility, and signal transmission.

courses.name: Computer Networks
courses.description: Network engineering course covering OSI/TCP-IP models, routing protocols (RIP, OSPF, BGP), switching technologies, and network security fundamentals. Hands-on configuration of enterprise network infrastructure including VLANs, firewalls, and load balancers.

courses.name: Electrical Circuits
courses.description: Circuit analysis fundamentals including Kirchhoff's laws, nodal and mesh analysis, transient response of RC/RL/RLC circuits, AC steady-state analysis, and three-phase power systems. PSpice simulation for circuit design verification and frequency response analysis.

courses.name: Programming Languages
courses.description: Comparative study of programming paradigms including functional (Scheme, Haskell), logic (Prolog), and imperative languages. Covered formal language theory (BNF, grammars), operational/denotational semantics, lexical analysis, and interpreter implementation.

courses.name: Databases
courses.description: Database systems engineering covering conceptual modeling (ER diagrams), relational model theory, normalization (1NF-BCNF), SQL programming, transaction management (ACID), and physical database design. Query optimization and indexing strategies for performance tuning.

courses.name: Artificial Language Technologies
courses.description: Compiler construction course covering lexical analysis (Lex), syntax analysis (Yacc), semantic analysis, intermediate code generation (P-code), and machine code generation. Built complete compiler pipeline for custom programming language with optimization phases.

courses.name: Elements of Biology
courses.description: Biomedical engineering fundamentals covering cell biology, biochemistry, human physiology, and biological interfaces. Studied biosensor technologies, microscopy techniques, and biophysical phenomena relevant to medical device design and biomedical signal processing.

courses.name: Computer Architecture
courses.description: Processor design fundamentals covering MIPS instruction set architecture, assembly programming, datapath design, pipelining, and memory hierarchy. Implemented ALU, register files, and control units with focus on performance optimization and hazard handling.

courses.name: Software Engineering
courses.description: Software development lifecycle management covering requirements engineering, UML modeling (use cases, class/sequence diagrams), design patterns, testing methodologies, and Agile practices. Applied Petri nets for process modeling and refactoring techniques for code quality improvement.

courses.name: Advanced Java & C Programming
courses.description: Advanced programming course covering Java (multithreading, networking, GUI development with Swing, MVC architecture) and C (memory management, pointers, dynamic allocation, system programming). Built networked applications and low-level system utilities.

courses.name: Computer Science Fundamentals
courses.description: Introduction to programming and computer organization covering C and Java languages, data structures, memory models, CPU architecture, and peripheral interfaces. Built foundation for algorithmic thinking and software development practices.

courses.name: Mathematical Analysis I
courses.description: Single-variable calculus covering limits, continuity, differentiation, integration techniques, series convergence, and function analysis. Applied mathematical rigor to engineering problem-solving including optimization and rate-of-change applications.

courses.name: Mathematical Analysis II
courses.description: Multivariable calculus and optimization covering metric spaces, partial derivatives, multiple integrals, vector calculus, and calculus of variations. Combined with operations research fundamentals including linear programming and graph theory applications.

courses.name: Operative Research
courses.description: Operations research methods covering linear programming (simplex method), integer programming, network optimization, and decision theory. Applied Gurobi solver for real-world optimization problems in scheduling, logistics, and resource allocation.

courses.name: Physics I
courses.description: Classical mechanics course covering kinematics, Newtonian dynamics, work-energy principles, fluid mechanics, gravitational systems, thermodynamics, and wave phenomena. Applied physics principles to engineering analysis and problem-solving.

courses.name: Automatic Control
courses.description: Control systems engineering covering system modeling, transfer functions, stability analysis (Routh-Hurwitz, Nyquist), frequency domain methods (Bode plots), and controller design (PID tuning). Applied MATLAB for control system simulation and analysis.

courses.name: Chemistry
courses.description: General chemistry covering atomic structure, chemical bonding, reaction stoichiometry, thermodynamics, equilibrium, and kinetics. Applied chemistry principles to material science and engineering process understanding.
